preparation: Mix 5kg cow dung + 1L cow urine + 1kg jaggery + 500g pulse flour + 2kg soil; ferment 2–3 days; dilute 1:200.;Set up vermiculture bed with cow dung and kitchen waste; harvest extract as vermicompost tea.;Brew compost tea 24-48 hrs; dilute for application.

organic: Bone Meal, Rock Phosphate, Compost+Bone Meal
preparation: Mix bone meal with compost (3:10 ratio); apply during sowing.;Use rock phosphate incorporated into soil at planting.;Combine bone meal with well-rotted compost for slow P release.

organic: Banana Peel Fertilizer, Wood Ash, Compost Tea
preparation: Dry banana peels → grind into powder → mix with compost → apply near root zone.;Collect wood ash and mix with compost; apply as top dressing.;Prepare compost tea and add potassium-rich additives like wood ash.
Mix 2kg wood ash with 10kg compost; apply during flowering.;Add bone meal to improve phosphorus availability.
Brew compost tea 48 hrs; dilute for foliar feed.;Steep vermicompost for extract; use as top dressing.;Mix wood ash with compost for K boost.

organic: Fermented Cow Dung Solution (FCC), Compost Tea
preparation: Ferment cow dung + jaggery + gram flour for 3 days; dilute 1:50.;Use compost tea to supply N and S organically.
Collect eggshells, clean, dry, crush to fine powder; mix with compost.;Apply dolomite where magnesium and calcium needed.

organic: Epsom Salt Organic Alternative (Mg flower tonic), Compost Tea
preparation: Mix 1tbsp epsom salt (organic grade) in 1L water; spray weekly.;Use compost tea enriched with Mg-rich plant material.
Mix neem cake 2kg per 20kg soil; improves micronutrient uptake.;Add zinc-rich ash or zinc-bearing amendments to compost.

organic: Banana Stem Tea, Wood Ash Tea
preparation: Boil banana stem pieces 20 min → cool → filter → use as liquid fertilizer.;Prepare wood ash tea and dilute before application.
Ferment cow urine with jaggery for 2 days; dilute 1:50 for foliar spray.;Use compost tea as organic N source.

organic: Bone Meal, Banana Peel Mix, Compost
preparation: Mix dried banana peel powder with bone meal (1:1); apply during flowering.;Incorporate compost to balance nutrients.

organic: Wood Ash + Compost Mix, Bone Meal
preparation: Mix 2kg wood ash with 8kg compost; apply near root zone.;Add bone meal for P.
Steep vermicompost in water 24 hrs; filter; use as foliar spray.;Brew compost tea and use as foliar feed.

organic: Plant-Based Magnesium Tea (spinach tea), Compost Tea
preparation: Boil spinach leaves 10 min → cool → strain → dilute 1:2.;Use compost tea enriched with Mg plant material.
Crush eggshells + mix with compost in planting beds.;Add bone meal for calcium where needed.
